Thanks

@tristaZero Not yet. After the dialect loading rule tables and the single tables are completed, the parallel check logic will be refactored, and the dialect loading method will be introduced. This problem will be fixed at that time.

It looks like shardingsphere-proxy-backend cannot be built on unix.
How to check and solve this problem? I just added a Markdown file to the document.🤔
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/61236603/129482288-227bd9d2-2b3e-4c9c-bab0-3bfe25c006db.png)

> tuning

Great!  As you said, we are very much looking forward to upgrading to the new version to reduce maintenance costs.
Because the tps of our system is one hundred thousand level, so the performance is very important, thank you for help
@cqiwencom From your log, it looks like a parsing exception, not a readwrite splitting exception. Can you try the master branch?

> @strongduanmu Could you look at this one?

@tristaZero I will investigate this issue.
@LeeGuoPing This PR seems to have some conflicts, can you resolve it?
@JiekerTime Can you provide the create table statement of t_order?

**The following is mainly dependent on version information**
```
<java.version>1.8</java.version>
<spring-cloud.version>Greenwich.SR5</spring-cloud.version>


<parent>
        <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
        <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-parent</artifactId>
        <version>2.1.3.RELEASE</version>
        <relativePath/>
    </parent>

 <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.shardingsphere</groupId>
            <artifactId>sharding-jdbc-spring-boot-starter</artifactId>
            <version>4.1.1</version>
 </dependency>

 <dependency>
            <groupId>io.shardingsphere</groupId>
            <artifactId>sharding-transaction-spring-boot-starter</artifactId>
            <version>3.1.0</version>
</dependency>
```

Hi @sgc109 @cqiwencom 
These problems do exist, because different clients or even different versions will send different SQL statements when they connect. It is very complicated.
We have recorded these issues, and some adaptation plans will be required later.

> @JiekerTime Can you provide the create table statement of t_order?

In fact you can change the table structure as you like, if you want to reproduce it, you can refer to [init.sql](https://github.com/apache/shardingsphere/blob/master/shardingsphere-test/shardingsphere-integration-test/shardingsphere-integration-test-suite/src/test/resources/env/db/init-sql/mysql/init.sql).
@sydgeek  Thanks for your carefulness, are you interested in fixing these problems?

> Please configure `overwrite` as true and try again.
I set overwrite as true, solve it, but /rules in zk has nothing
[zk: localhost:2181(CONNECTED) 5] ls /rules
[]

> Is `overwrite` configured as true in governance configuration?

configure `overwrite` as true, it works, thank you @menghaoranss
